body: r_c wails when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} the body of m_c, still and cold in the clearing. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/sit/sits} vigil that night as grief fills {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} heart.

r_c fusses gently with m_c's fur, hiding the evidence of what killed {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/want/wants} to remember {PRONOUN/m_c/object} as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} in life, not like this.
As the Clan sits vigil, r_c's voice cracks with grief, talking about the time {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had with m_c.
